meanings.definition: To inhale audibly through the nose to detect a smell.
meanings.sent1: The dog sniffs the flower to smell it.
meanings.sent2: She sniffs the air to see if she can detect any cookies baking.
meanings.sent3: The detective sniffs around the crime scene for clues.
meanings.sent4: The curious child sniffs at the unfamiliar object cautiously.
meanings.sent5: The chef sniffs the ingredients to ensure they are fresh.

meanings.definition: A quick inhalation or exhalation of air through the nose.
meanings.sent1: He let out a quick sniff before sneezing.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit gave a little sniff before hopping away.
meanings.sent3: The baby's cute sniff made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: A sniff of the fresh air invigorated her senses.
meanings.sent5: The sudden sniff caught her by surprise.

meanings.definition: A brief or slight smell or whiff.
meanings.sent1: She caught a sniff of the delicious pie baking in the oven.
meanings.sent2: A sniff of the ocean breeze brought back memories of childhood vacations.
meanings.sent3: The sniff of perfume lingered in the room long after she left.
meanings.sent4: The sniff of danger in the air made him cautious.
meanings.sent5: The sniff of fresh flowers filled the room with a pleasant aroma.
